intro: Crassula capitella subsp. meyeri, commonly known as the "Lemon Lime Jade," is a succulent native to South Africa. It features dense clusters of fleshy, oval-shaped leaves that are typically light green to yellowish in color. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or purple during the summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it ideal for arid environments. Its compact growth habit and vibrant foliage make it a popular choice for rock gardens and container planting.
